name: Holiday Inn Resort Los Cabos All-Inclusive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our 1st experience with an all inclusive resort. We will never cruise again. The service and the food was the best! There were 3 different pools we loved the adult pool -very quite and relaxing.
reviews.title: I want to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were a little disappointed that you could not swim in the ocean because of the rip tides but we enjoyed sitting on the beach at night.
reviews.title: Nicely done...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you President Inter-Continental Los Cabos, Mexico for one of the best Vacations ever!
reviews.title: Can recommend the Presidente without hesitation!
Top Knotch Resort - Best Ever! (Toronto, Ontario)
reviews.text: Dates of stay: May 26 to May 29, 2007

reviews.title: Go somewhere else
reviews.text: Room: 3316 (one king, small balcony, ocean/pool view)

A little background on my previous travels, so that you know where I'm coming from with my review: We are in our mid to late 30's with one 6 year old. Prior All-inlcusives include Moon Palace Cancun, Beaches in Punta Cana and Puerto Plata, Occidental Xcaret in Playa Del Carmen. Cruises include Princess, Norwegian and Windstar.
reviews.title: General review of the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel--The hotel grounds itself is pretty small. This is good and bad. It's good that everything is so close to each other, but the pools are pretty small. It cannot be compared to giant pools with lazy rivers, like those of Playa Del Carmen. Considering that the beach is unuseable for swimming, the pools were a 3/5 overall.
reviews.title: Boring,boring,boring

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms--We got the 1st floor pool front Terrace rooms. We paid a little more to get these and they were worth it. First, no stairs and second, they had the hammocks right outside your sliding glass window. The rooms were about 3/5 stars. Nothing fancy but it served its purpose.
reviews.title: Too short a stay, but it was sweet

likes.liked: — Never seemed crowded 3 very separate pool choices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food-- the food was actually the best part of the deal. I could honestly say that the food was best of all the All-Inclusives that I've been to. Furthermore, the reservations restaurant food was was on the border of really good to great. My only complaint was that there was only one buffet and one restaurant. They boast multiple restaurants, but that's misleading, because they only open one restaurant per night. They might as well claim that they have 13 restaurants, since they will rotate and open just one a night, anyway. Room service food was good and timely and it costs $2.50 per delivery charge. I hate being nickel and dimed. If you're going to call it an All-inclusive then please live up to your claim. Also, at the restaurants, there is a section on the menu which is extra charge, if you order items such as shrimp, steaks, lobster...etc. Again, if you're going to sell it as an all-inclusive, please be ALL-INCLUSIVE!! The snack bar has pretty darn good quesadillas and nachos.
reviews.title: Bad Beds, Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beach--They're not kidding folks. It cannot be used for swimming. First of all, the waves are pretty dangerous, including its undertow. Secondly, you don't want to go near it because there is so much horse poop, from the horse riding activity. From the hotel grounds, the beach and water are very pretty. But don't get much closer than that.
reviews.title: Loved the all inclusive resort! I strongly recommend this place!

likes.liked: — room service was the best! Also, if need help avail the concierge service they are very helpful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: People who have been to Cabo know that you cannot swim in the ocean on the Pacific side (IE, MOST of the beach areas), but no hotel, including this one, mentions that on their Web sites. The location was nice but you can only swim in the pool--boring! The food was also so-so & without much variety. They always seemed to be out of champagne, too. I wouldn't do all-inclusive again. The room was nice enough, though. And the old town area was quaint. Downtown is a rather long, sweaty bus ride away in August, FYI
reviews.title: Can't swim in the ocean, always out of champagne....

likes.disliked: — the food & lack of ocean swimmability

reviews.text: The El Presidente has become our families annual summer vacation trip. This was our 4th visit to the resort and we certainly plan to visit the resort again next year. My wife and I are in our 30's and brought along our 18 month old and 4 year old boys.
reviews.title: Our families perfect annual vacation week.

reviews.text: First off, a special thank you to General Manager Michael Oney. Mr. Oney is a hands on G.M and makes himself quite available. We always e-mail Mr. Oney when we book the trip and Mr. Oney handles our requests prior to arrival. Mr. Oney will be the first to tell you that it is his staff that makes the El Presidente run so well. The staff works very hard and does so with a smile. I have never had an issue with any of the staff members at this resort.
reviews.title: Definitely Go Here

reviews.text: The rooms at the resort are average. My family and I prefer the first floor rooms as they have a large patio with a hammock. The rooms have a TV and several HBO, ESPN, etc channels. We find ourselves in the room only to sleep so the room accommodations have never been an issue. The rooms are clean and maid service adds nice touches on a daily basis.
reviews.title: Great Vacation!!

likes.liked: — The staff - extremely friendly, efficient, and welcoming!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food at the resort is quite good. I'm always puzzled at the reviews stating the food is average or below average and have come to the conclusion that those eating at the buffets each night are drawing those conclusions. A couple from Ohio that we met advised that they were disappointed in the food. They had only been eating at the buffets. We suggested they eat at a "reservation" restaurant and the next day they advised the food was great. The El Presidente is unique in the "all inclusive" world in that they have multiple sit down dinner restaurants. The restaurants all require a reservation. The resort must need a reservation in order to meet appropriate staffing at the dinners. I have been to the resort 4 times and have never had a problem getting a dinner reservation for the family. I simply see the concierge before 11A.M and make a reservation. The sit down dinners at the 3 restaurants are great and simply make the resort. Each restaurant specializes in something different and it is a relaxing way to spend the evenings. The dinners last about 2 hours and you get everything from appetizers to dessert. The dinners are meant to be long and again is a nice way to spend the evening with friends or with your family.
reviews.title: Good time

reviews.text: Wannabe four star resort with three star rooms, as for my experience went.
reviews.title: Good resort/hotel, but....

likes.liked: — The Kids club and the general manager was very helpful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good for families with kids.
reviews.title: If you want a QUIET resort in the off season...this one is for you.

likes.disliked: — Nothing to do after 9:00pm, No show, No disco, No Music at the bar... NOTHING

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great kids club, with good teachers.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our vacation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: June 2007
reviews.title: Just keeps getting better and better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: IF YOU ARE LOOKING FOR A PLACE WITH LOTS TO DO ON THE RESORT...THIS IS NOT FOR YOU! During the slow season that is. We are 24 and 25 years old. The whole resort shut down at 9:00pm. There is no show and no Disco. We are not partiers, but something would have really made this trip a lot better. After 9:00 we either sat and looked at oneanother or watched tv in our room.
reviews.title: Not quite a 5 star but we enjoyed it very much

likes.disliked: — pushy time share people disguised as hotel staff

description: Nestled between a white sand beach and the Sierra de San Lazaro Mountains, Holiday Inn Resort Los Cabos is truly "at one" with the environment. At or near the resort, you’ll golf, play tennis, swim and ride horses while younger guests explore the Chiqui Kids Club. To expand your fun in the sun, Cabo San Lucas and San Jose del Cabo are minutes away.
